item.title: Upgrading the blog, day 2
item.description: Last time up on setting up nginx to make PageSpeed Insight happy, we saw that tweaking the webserver wasn’t enough, so now we will have to work on the content. Compress html output minify & pre-compress js/css assets optimize media assets Compress (minify) html output There are a bunch of solutions for this step, as of now i’m using the simpler approach of “jekyll-compress”, it’s an html “compressor” that work in pure “Liquid” (the templating language of jekyll), so no strange ruby installation and whatnot, you only need to fetch the compress.
